However, social ethical issues such as discrimination and privacy are the biggest concerns and potential barriers to enforcing patients or doctors to disclose information to patients' relatives. Currently, under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) in the United States, there is no legal obligation to disclose information to relatives; it is up to the patient's wish to disclose to their family members.
